page.title: 07A Smallholding Near Huntley
page.content: The owners of Prestbury Farm have lived there for forty years.The 2.43 hectares that they own is grazing land. They used to have 12.96 hectares but they sold the other 10.53 ha. Before they retired they sold milk and cattle. They have a small garden in which they grow vegetables,such as beans, beetroot and carrots.These are sold to people in the area. There used to be many more farm buildings before the owners retired, but a lot of them were pulled down because they were not being used. They say it is much worse for farmers in 1985 than in the 1970's, because of the Common Market polices.
